subject: Sexual Health
title: The Uterus
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Uterus usable.

hook.text: The uterus is a muscular organ the size of a pear, yet it can stretch to hold a full-term baby.

buildup.text: Its thick walls are made of smooth muscle that contracts powerfully during childbirth.

discovery.text: The uterine lining, called the endometrium, thickens each month to prepare for a fertilized egg.

twist.text: If no egg implants, the lining sheds. This monthly shedding is what causes menstrual bleeding.

climax.text: During pregnancy, the uterus expands to 500 times its normal volume, then shrinks back afterward.

punchline.text: A pear-sized organ that can house a whole person.

quiz.question: What happens to the uterine lining when no egg implants?
